title: Strictly Come Dancing 2020: Neil Jones and three pros denied celebs
text:
Four Strictly pros will go without celebs this year (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing has confirmed that Neil Jones is one of the four professional dancers who will miss out on getting a celebrity partner in 2020.

Executive producer Sarah Jones has revealed that due to the show’s restricted time limit, there has had to be a shuffle around the team.

Speaking to Metro.co.uk and other outlets, Sarah explained: ‘We have four professional dancers who won’t be partnering celebrities this year.

‘They are Nadia Bychkova, Neil Jones, Graziano Di Prima and Nancy Xu. So we have two males and two females, and they will be forming some CCC’s together, so that they are able to dance to the guest music acts.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

CCCs – close contact cohorts – are a kind of social bubble that means you have to break social distancing in order to do your job.

‘To be in a CCC, it has to be an exclusive CCC, so it has to just be with one person, and you are regularly tested to be in one,’ Sarah added.

Neil was finally given a shot at the glitterball last year with Alex Scott after fan demand (Picture: BBC)

‘On top of that, we are also asking our celebrities and dancers to be part of an exclusive support bubble, which is a kind of wider term also available to everybody in the public, but that means that one half of the party has to live alone.

‘So either the dancer or the celebrity will be living on their own in order to form the exclusive support bubble.’

As they will be on stand-by, all four will have to enter a CCC bubble anyway.

Graziano has only performed in the competition once (Picture: PA)

Nadiya Bychkova was partnered with David James last year (Picture: BBC)

The news will come as a blow to fans of the dancers, with three of the four previously competing for the glitterball.

Neil, who has been on the show since 2016, was only given his first celebrity partner last year, teaming up with Alex Scott after fan outcry to see him in the game.

Graziano joined the series in 2018 and was teamed up with DJ Vick Hope, but was demoted in 2019 as his height made him an impractical partner.

While Nancy has yet to be given a celebrity teammate, Nadiya has been in the competition for the past three years – trying her luck with Davood Ghadami, Lee Ryan, and David James.

Strictly Come Dancing will return this Autumn on BBC One.
